title: Female Lichen Sclerosus Relief Programme
tagline: Calm Flares. Repair Tissue. Protect Comfort.
description: Doctor-led PRP, LED light therapy, and barrier repair plans that soothe vulvar lichen sclerosus and prevent long-term scarring.
longDescription: Lichen sclerosus can cause burning, itching, whitened patches, and painful intimacy. Our female programme blends anti-inflammatory platelet-rich plasma (PRP) injections, red/near-infrared LED therapy, prescription barrier creams, and microbiome support to heal micro-tears and reduce flare frequency.\n\nConsultations take place in private suites with optional female chaperones. We document changes with encrypted photography only when you consent, monitor hormones and autoimmune markers, and provide digital flare diaries so you can message the clinic discreetly between appointments.

seo.metaTitle: Female Lichen Sclerosus Treatment London | Dr. SNA Clinic
seo.metaDescription: Specialist care for female lichen sclerosus: PRP, LED therapy, prescription topicals, and lifestyle guidance in a discreet medical clinic.

hero.headline: Finally, Relief for Vulvar Lichen Sclerosus
hero.subheadline: Regenerative medicine + dermatology expertise to soothe and protect delicate tissue.

overview.title: Holistic Management for a Chronic Condition
overview.content: We begin with a gentle exam, hormone review, and swabs or biopsy if needed. Treatment blends PRP to thicken fragile skin, LED therapy to reduce inflammation, compounded topicals to repair the barrier, and guidance on hygiene, clothing, and supplements. You’ll leave with a clear plan for daily care and flare management.
highlights: Symptoms often calm within the first week
Protects against fusion, scarring, and sexual discomfort
Digital flare diary and direct messaging with your doctor

howItWorks.title: Regeneration Meets Anti-Inflammatory Light
howItWorks.subtitle: Why PRP + LED calm LS
howItWorks.content: PRP releases growth factors (PDGF, VEGF, EGF) that speed up healing, thicken the epidermis, and improve microcirculation. LED therapy at 630 nm and 830 nm reduces inflammatory cytokines and supports melanocyte balance. Together they minimise itching, restore colour, and protect tissue from tearing.

benefits.title: Anti-Inflammatory
benefits.description: LED down-regulates TNF-α and IL-6 for calmer skin.

candidacy.title: Are You a Candidate?
candidacy.subtitle: Most women living with LS qualify
suitable: Diagnosed lichen sclerosus with recurrent symptoms
Women experiencing painful intimacy or tearing
Post-surgical patients wanting to protect remaining tissue
Those coordinating care with gynaecology or dermatology
notSuitable: Active infection that requires antibiotics first
Uncontrolled autoimmune conditions without specialist clearance
Allergy to topical anaesthetics used during treatment
candidacy.note: Suitability confirmed after labs, swabs, and review of current medications.

safety.title: Safety & Governance
safety.content: Our clinic is CQC-regulated, uses sterile single-use kits, and stores imagery in encrypted files with your written consent. Female clinicians are available for every visit.

certifications.name: GMC + NMC Team

comparisons.duration: Permanent but may not stop recurrence

testimonials.name: Amelia C.
testimonials.text: Within 10 days the itching stopped and the whitening softened. I only reach for steroids during a flare now and intimacy no longer hurts.

testimonials.name: Bethany L.
testimonials.text: I wish I’d found this sooner. Quarterly PRP keeps symptoms quiet and the team checks in before I even think to ask.

faq.question: Do I still need steroids?
faq.answer: Yes, but usually only during flares. Our programme reduces frequency and reliance on potent creams.

faq.question: Will PRP cure LS?
faq.answer: LS is chronic; PRP and LED keep it in remission, protect tissue, and lessen symptoms.

faq.question: Can I remain uncircumcised/avoid surgery?
faq.answer: Many patients avoid excision when inflammation is controlled. We coordinate with your gynaecologist if surgery is recommended.

faq.question: Is PRP safe?
faq.answer: PRP is your own blood processed sterilely. Side effects are limited to temporary redness or warmth.

faq.question: How often do I need maintenance?
faq.answer: Most women return every 3-6 months for LED or booster PRP depending on severity.

faq.question: Can LS increase cancer risk?
faq.answer: Chronic inflammation can raise risk slightly. Regular monitoring and treatment reduce that risk. We coordinate smears and biopsies when needed.
